page.title: 20Liskeard,1086 and Credits
page.content: The{Domesday Book}refers to the manor of Liskeard,rather than the town, in the following terms: "It is taxed for 2 hydes.There are, however,12 hydes.The arable land is 60 carrucates.There are in demesne 3 carrucates and 20 serfs and 35 villains,and 37 borderers, with 13 plough teams.There are rents of market 4 shillings,of mills 12 shillings,400 acres of wood; pasture 4 leagues long and 2 leagues wide.It was formerly worth Â£8,now Â£26,less 20 pence." {CREDITS:}information compiled in draft form by the children of{Liskeard {Junior School}who were aided,when necessary, by their class teachers and parents. Useful contibutions also came from the{Liskeard Infants.}Thanks must go to John Boyles, Sarah Lane and Georgina Holmes who helped with the final editting and entry of the data.
